title: Program exits with "signal arrived during external code execution" on windows
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: erigon version 2.45.0-dev-eae2d9a7

OS & Version: Windows 10 22H2 19045.3086

Go Version: go version go1.20.5 windows/amd64

GCC Version: gcc.exe (tdm64-1) 10.3.0

Commit hash: eae2d9a79cb70dbe30b3a6b79c436872e4605458

Erigon Command (with flags/config): .\erigon --datadir erigon-data

Concensus Layer: None

Chain/Network: Mainnet

#### Expected behaviour
Erigon starts and wait for consensus node connection

#### Actual behaviour
Erigon exits and outputs the following information:
```
PS D:\erigon\build\bin> .\erigon.exe --datadir erigon-data
INFO[06-17|20:29:35.276] logging to file system                   log dir=erigon-data\\logs file prefix=erigon log level=info json=false
INFO[06-17|20:29:35.297] Build info                               git_branch=devel git_tag=y1.2.5-268-geae2d9a79 git_commit=eae2d9a79cb70dbe30b3a6b79c436872e4605458
INFO[06-17|20:29:35.298] Starting Erigon on Ethereum mainnet...
INFO[06-17|20:29:35.302] Maximum peer count                       ETH=100 total=100
INFO[06-17|20:29:35.303] starting HTTP APIs                       APIs=eth,erigon,engine
INFO[06-17|20:29:35.303] torrent verbosity                        level=WRN
INFO[06-17|20:29:37.434] Set global gas cap                       cap=50000000
INFO[06-17|20:29:37.489] [Downloader] Runnning with               ipv6-enabled=true ipv4-enabled=true download.rate=16mb
 upload.rate=4mb
INFO[06-17|20:29:37.492] Opening Database                         label=chaindata path=D:\\erigon\\build\\bin\\erigon-data\\chaindata
Exception 0xc0000005 0x8 0x0 0x0
PC=0x0
signal arrived during external code execution

runtime.cgocall(0x7ff7d251baa0, 0xc000819530)
        runtime/cgocall.go:157 +0x4a fp=0xc000819508 sp=0xc0008194d0 pc=0x7ff7d0bf52ca
```

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Using the provided `wmake.ps1` to build, and run `erigon --datadir data`

AFAIK this is probably because it's not best to run erigon on windows. 

Might work for you, but try setting this ENV variable `GO_EXTLINK_ENABLED=0` or rebuild and add `-linkmode internal` as a build arg

This will disable linking which with cmd/go and windows doesn't play well together (https://pkg.go.dev/cmd/go)

> AFAIK this is probably because it's not best to run erigon on windows.
> 
> Might work for you, but try setting this ENV variable `GO_EXTLINK_ENABLED=0` or rebuild and add `-linkmode internal` as a build arg
> 
> This will disable linking which with cmd/go and windows doesn't play well together (https://pkg.go.dev/cmd/go)

I tried to add `-linkmode internal` to `$Erigon.BuildFlags`, but unfortunately my go.exe cannot recognize this flag.

I will try WSL for now while still looking forward to a available native Windows version, because WSL takes additional memory and lowers IO speed anyway.
